CollaborativeContent.Title: Title of Documents
CollaborativeContent.Content: A TEENAGER yesterday accused his parents of cruelty by feeding hin a daily diet of chips which sent his weight ballooning to 22st at the age of 12. the document shall be sent tot he

Annotation.recommendation: Possible spelling mistake found Suggested correction: [in, his, him, win, hit, hip, thin, bin, pin, tin, chin, hid, hind, Hi, Lin, din, gin, hi, hint, kin, hen, shin, yin, ain, HIV, fin, sin, Hon, Hun, Min, hie, min, h in, hi n]
chips is a common American expression, in British English it is more common to use: crisps. Suggested correction: [crisps]
This sentence does not start with an uppercase letter Suggested correction: [The]
Did you mean <suggestion>to the</suggestion>? Suggested correction: [to the]

annotatedCollaborativeContentAnalysis.OverallRecommendations: Quality is very poor, correct the errors
